title: Jenny Hval Cancels 2025 North American Tour Dates
description: The Norwegian artist was set to perform in major cities across the United States and Canada this September
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The Norwegian artist was set to perform in major cities across the United States and Canada this September
text: Jenny Hval has cancelled her forthcoming North American tour dates in support of her new album, Iris Silver Mist. The Norwegian artist shared the news in a statement posted to Instagram earlier today (June 30). Hval was set to perform in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Portland, Vancouver, Chicago, Toronto, and New York City this September. Read her full message below.Hval did not share a specific reason for the cancellation. However, artists such as FKA Twigs and Mexico’s Grupo Firme have struggled with obtaining timely U.S. tour visas under the Trump administration. “I’m really sorry for the change and hope to see you at another show soon,” Hval wrote. She last toured North America in 2022.Hval released Iris Silver Mist in May. Her ninth studio album was led by the singles “To Be a Rose” and “The Artist is Absent.”Read about Iris Silver Mist in “The Best Music of 2025 So Far.”Jenny Hval:09-05 Los Angeles, CA - Lodge Room09-06 San Francisco, CA - The Independent09-08 Portland, OR - Polaris09-10 Vancouver, British Columbia - Biltmore Cabaret09-12 Chicago, IL - Sleeping Village09-15 Toronto, Ontario - Longboat Hall09-17 Brooklyn, NY - Music Hall of Williamsburg
html:
Jenny Hval has cancelled her forthcoming North American tour dates in support of her new album, Iris Silver Mist. The Norwegian artist shared the news in a statement posted to Instagram earlier today (June 30). Hval was set to perform in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Portland, Vancouver, Chicago, Toronto, and New York City this September. Read her full message below.

Hval did not share a specific reason for the cancellation. However, artists such as FKA Twigs and Mexico’s Grupo Firme have struggled with obtaining timely U.S. tour visas under the Trump administration. “I’m really sorry for the change and hope to see you at another show soon,” Hval wrote. She last toured North America in 2022.

Hval released Iris Silver Mist in May. Her ninth studio album was led by the singles “To Be a Rose” and “The Artist is Absent.”

Read about Iris Silver Mist in “The Best Music of 2025 So Far.”

Jenny Hval:

09-05 Los Angeles, CA - Lodge Room
09-06 San Francisco, CA - The Independent
09-08 Portland, OR - Polaris
09-10 Vancouver, British Columbia - Biltmore Cabaret
09-12 Chicago, IL - Sleeping Village
09-15 Toronto, Ontario - Longboat Hall
09-17 Brooklyn, NY - Music Hall of Williamsburg
